articles.author: Laura Geggel
articles.title: Neanderthals cared for 6-year-old with Down syndrome, fossil find reveals - Livescience.com
articles.description: The unique shape of an ear bone belonging to a Neanderthal child found in a cave in Spain suggests that she had Down syndrome.
articles.content:
A 6-year-old Neanderthal child had Down syndrome
, a new analysis of an oddly shaped ear bone found in a cave in Spain suggests.
The finding is the first known case of Down syndrome in Neanderthals… [+3338 chars]

articles.title: The Secret to Longer Life? Scientists Uncover Unexpected Health Benefits of Eating Small Fish - SciTechDaily
articles.description: In Japan, people habitually eat small fish, such as whitebait, Atlantic capelin, Japanese smelt, and small dried sardines. Notably, it is common practice to consume small fish whole, including the head, bones, and organs, which are rich in micronutrients, suc…
articles.content:
Eating small fish whole can prolong life expectancy, a Japanese study finds. Credit: Chinatsu Kasahara
In Japan, people habitually eat small fish, such as whitebait, Atlantic capelin, Japanese smelt… [+5227 chars]

articles.author: Vladimir Hedrih
articles.title: Individuals with PTSD exhibit numerous neural connectivity pattern alterations - PsyPost
articles.description: Canadian researchers discovered distinct brain connectivity patterns in dissociative PTSD patients, revealing hyperconnectivity that likely compensates to maintain global brain function, offering new insights into the neural impact of trauma.
articles.content: A neuroimaging study in Canada found functional connectivity differences between individuals suffering from dissociative PTSD and healthy participants across many different regions of the brain. Rese… [+4730 chars]
